text: Abdul Waheed (30 November 1936 â€“ 21 February 2022), also known as Abdul Waheed Khan, born in the British Raj, was a Pakistani field hockey player. He won an Olympic gold medal at the 1960 Summer Olympics. He played center-forward, and scored Pakistan's first goal in the final match against India during the 1960 Summer Olympics. Waheed died in Karachi, Pakistan on 21 February 2022, at the age of 85. ==References== Category:1936 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Olympic gold medalists for Pakistan Category:Pakistani field hockey players
title: Abdul Waheed (field hockey)
